intro: Lastrea lauterbachii, commonly known as the Lauterbach's lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
